meta.note: What's the name of the course?
The slug controls the URL for the course.
Short 2-3 sentence description of the course.
The featured image for your course. Typically shown in a course card.
Longer, more detailed description that supports HTML formatting. Shown on the course detail page.
Rating for the review of this course.
Feedback from the reviewer.
What course is the review for?
Response from an instructor of the course regarding the feedback of the review.
On what date did the user enroll in the course?
What percentage of the lessons in the course have been completed?
Course that the user enrolled in.
Which user enrolled in the course?
What date was the course completed?
Has the user complete the course?
The instructors job title or byline.
Instructor headshot or image.
Rich text bio of the instructor. 3-5 sentences / 2 paragraph maximum is a good target.
What type of link / service is this?
What is the full URL?
Social media profiles and other important links for an instructor.
The slug controls the URL for the instructor detail page.
Which course module does this lesson belong to?
Name of this lesson.
The slug controls the URL for this lesson.
Short 2-3 sentence description of this lesson's content.
Is the lesson video hosted on a third party service or stored inside the LMS?
The file for the video.
The external URL for the video (YouTube, Vimeo, Loom, others)
The rich text content for the lesson. Show below the video.
Transcript for the video to include in the lesson.
How long is the video in seconds?
Name of the chapter.
When does this chapter start in the video (in elapsed seconds)?
Create chapters for longer videos that allow users to skip forward.
What date was this lesson published?
Name of this resource.
Short 1-2 sentence description of the resource.
File for the resource.
Full URL for this resource.
The name of the module.
Short 1-2 sentence description of the module.
What type of link / service is this?
What is the full URL?
Social media links to display in various positions within the LMS.
Title to display on the LMS frontend.
1 sentence tagline to display on the LMS frontend.
Short 1-2 sentence description to display on the LMS frontend and in SEO meta tags.
What is the parent folder for all the individual course folders? This is used in flows to create folders whenever a new course is created.
Name of this learning track.
The slug controls the URL for this learning track.
Rich text description of what the user will learn from this track.
Cover image for this learning track.

options.text: Topics are a way to organize courses and let users zoom in on what they're most interested in. They are similar to tags in that each course could cover several topics.

meta.note: The specific courses that this instructor teaches.
Which lessons have been completed?
Modules are the different groups of lessons within your course.
Who are the instructors for this course?
What lessons are within this module?
Attach any helpful downloads, files, or links to this lesson.

options.text: Tracks are recommended learning paths for your users and students. Group courses together in the order you recommend that students complete them in.
Settings are the global settings for your LMS. They are typically used on the frontend for SEO tags, metadata, and shared global state.

meta.note: The courses in this learning tracking sorted in suggested order of completion.
What topics are covered in this course?

options.text: Enrollments are used to track user progress on a specific course. Create new enrollments via the API when users sign up for a course and create new items in the `lms_enrollments_lessons_completed` collection whenever they complete a lesson.
